intro: Hieracium prenanthes, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium prenanthes is often found in disturbed areas and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
